page.title: 08PEPLOW HALL ESTATE.
page.content: Originally Peplow Hall Estate consisted of over 1000 acres; then in 1923, 5 farms on the estate were sold to private buyers. The Hall itself is an early Georgian Residence standing in finely-timbered parklands boardering onto the River Tern and a man-made lake. The large gardens are tended by 2 full time gardeners with the gardens being open to the public on 2 or 3 times a year in aid of {Charities.} The present Estate consists of some 550 acres, employing 3 full time farm workers, one of whom is the farm manager. A gamekeeper is employed to rear game birds which are then released into the wild & shot for sport in the Autumn and Winter.
